events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred yesterday afternoon involving a collision with another vehicle at the intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' following initial assessment of reported vehicle damage and collision details.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the car accident case and manage communication with the claimant for next steps.
Acknowledgement of the claim was sent to the customer, expressing understanding and readiness to assist with the claim process.
The agent requested submission of the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and a copy of the driver’s license to support the investigation.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including photos, police report, and insurance information for processing the vehicle accident claim.
Investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and interviewing involved parties to verify the circumstances of the vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of liability and estimated repair costs prepared based on vehicle damage assessment.
A settlement offer was sent to the claimant including coverage details for damages, minus deductibles, in accordance with the policy terms.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the clarity and speed of communication.
The insurance company approved the claim for payment after all conditions were met and confirmation from the claimant was received.
Payment for vehicle repairs was issued electronically to the claimant’s bank account as agreed in the settlement terms.
The claim was officially closed after the payment process, with confirmation that the claimant’s issues regarding the accident have been fully resolved.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived following closure to ensure proper record keeping and future reference if needed.
